verses.text: Then Job answered and said:
How long will ye vex my soul And crush me to pieces with words?
These ten times ye have put me to shame, And set upon me unabashedly.
Well, be it that I have erred– Mine error abides with myself.
Or would ye be haughty to me, And insult me with your reproaches?
Know, then, it is God that hath wronged me, And compassed me round with His net.
Behold! I cry "Wrong" – but no answer; I call – but justice is none.
My way He hath fenced round impassably, Darkness He sets on my path.
He hath stripped my glory from off me, And taken the crown from my head.
He hath torn me clean down – I am gone: He hath plucked up my hope like a tree.
He hath kindled His anger against me, And counted me one of His enenmies.
On come His troops together; They throw up a rampart against me.
My brethren are gone far from me; My friends have estranged themselves from me.
My neighbours have ceased to acknowledge me; Guests of my house have forgotten me.
Maids of mine count me a stranger; A foreigner am I in their sight.
To my servant I call, but he answers not, Till with my mouth I entreat him.
My breath is strange to my wife, And my stench to mine own very children.
Yea, even young boys despise me, And mock me when I try to rise.
All mine intimate friends abhor me; The man whom I love turns against me.
My skin clings to my bones; I escape with my flesh in my teeth.
Have pity, have pity, my friends; For the hand of God hath touched me.
Why do ye persecute me like – God, And devour my flesh insatiably?
O that my words were now written, That they were inscribed in a book,
That with iron pen and with lead On a rock they were graven for ever.
I know that there liveth a Champion, Who will one day stand over my dust;
Yea, Another shall rise as My Witness, And, as Sponsor, shall I behold – God;
Whom mine eyes shall behold, and no stranger’s. My heart is faint in my bosom.
But if ye are determined to hunt me, And in me find the root of the matter,
Then dread ye the sword for yourselves; For wrath shall destroy the ungodly. Zophar’s Warning and Innuendo that Heaven and Earth have already Witnessed against Job
